This error was not reproducible in multiple falcon clusters. It is only seen in a specific test cluster, hence we suspect this to be environment issue and closing the Jira. Will reopen if it can be reproduced.

+1. Could you add comment that falcon will create baseDir and user will create dbName and jobName? Could you also comment that the user needs to be added to users group in order to run DR jobs? Thank you, @bvellanki .

@yzheng-hortonworks  This jira is not creating new behavior. It is fixing a bug in existing behavior. The users should not be aware of who creates what dir because the data stored under these dirs is "status of replication". This should be transparent to users.
Could you add a comment to the code? So other developers would be aware of this? Thank you!

+1

@bvellanki @pallavi-rao I propose to use Apache Yetus. It has several benefits over the existing approach
1. Generating changes.txt from jira is much more flexible than from commit messages. 
   As I noted earlier also, commits can't be modified, so if a developer forgets to attach metadata / attaches wrong metadata then generating release notes will be incorrect.
2. Yetus provides nice markdown formatted change log with links to each issue. They are easy to read and you can go to the jira by clicking through the github.
3. It can also automate the generation of release notes, if we add them to corresponding JIRA.
4. We don't need to write / maintain and go through all the existing/future learning that YETUS went through.

I have tested it and will send a pull request for the docs generated for all the releases through YETUS.
In view of FALCON-2063 I believe this change should also not be required.

Some important new features are listed as bug fixes in the generated Change log. I will go ahead and update the 0.10 Jiras to properly reflect compatibility, improvement, feature etc in an Apache Yetus compatible way. Then we need to re-generate the change-log.

The same needs to be done for atleast the previous release or we lose some important information on backwards compatibility, features, improvements etc. This is necessary because we look at changelog to debug any issues that arises during upgrades between versions.
The fix for Falcon-2061 was not supposed to go into 0.10. It was a mistake on my part, thank you @peeyushb  for creating this pull request to revert the commit.
LGTM :+1:

@bvellanki Agreed and it makes sense. Now we just have to keep JIRA correctly updated.  

This pull request was just to get a preview and get review done. I am also fixing some issues in the YETUS. Hopefully they will also be committed in the meantime  :smile: 

One more thing that we need to do is to add Release Notes in the JIRA itself so that we can generate release notes also automatically. I need to first get that field added in JIRA.

As for cleaning up the JIRA, I will help you out and pick up 0.7(I generated the release notes for 0.7 from JIRA so they should mostly be correct :stuck_out_tongue: ) and 0.8 releases.

This issue is causing failures on other pull requests and can hide other downstream issues in those pull requests. If anyone can please review / commit it ASAP, then it will be really nice.
